sectionTitle: Equity as a Call Option on the Firm’s Assets

columns.text: In this problem, we will learn about options.

Before we begin, let us first define call option.


**Call Option** is a contract that gives a holder the right to buy a stock.

### Requirement # 1

Equity in a leveraged firm is effectively a call option on the firm’s assets because stockholders can either acquire the assets of the firm or default on the debt. In case of a default, the bondholders will own the assets of the firm. Also, the stockholders will have a call option on the firm's assets.

### Requirement # 2

If all other things are the same, the stockholders of a firm will prefer to decrease the volatility of the firm’s return on assets because firms with low asset volatility can benefit from the tax advantage of debt while maintaining a low cost of financial hardship.

If all other things are the same, the bondholders will prefer to increase the volatility of the firm’s return on assets because high asset volatility 
means that the firm is growing faster due to access to more resources than its assets would generally allow.
